fields.description:
Currently there is a port of Arrow on vcpkg [1] that is maintained by folks outside the core Arrow developer community. We should consider formalizing distribution of Arrow releases through vcpkg, in collaboration with the existing maintainers of the Arrow vcpkg port if they are interested in staying involved.

[1] https://github.com/microsoft/vcpkg/tree/master/ports/arrow

comments.body: The primary maintainer of the Arrow vcpkg port is Tanguy Fautré at G-Research, who also maintains a .NET Parquet library which uses the Arrow vcpkg port: https://github.com/G-Research/ParquetSharp
Version 4.0.0 of the Arrow C++ library is now available through vcpkg.

This was discussed in this email thread in the dev list: https://lists.apache.org/thread.html/r9b21fbe8d8f5f5cbd02dc031244f7082ab91f788cbba424d551f623d%40%3Cdev.arrow.apache.org%3E

The [Release Management Guide|https://cwiki.apache.org/confluence/display/ARROW/Release+Management+Guide] now includes updating vcpkg port as a post-release task. Following the 5.0.0 release, I will update the guide to include some additional details.

A PR is open to update the arrow vcpkg port to 5.0.0 at [https://github.com/microsoft/vcpkg/pull/19229]. 5.0.0 is the first Arrow release for which we have treated the vcpkg port update as a formal Arrow post-release task.

The Release Management Guide now includes detailed instructions for updating the vcpkg port: [https://cwiki.apache.org/confluence/display/ARROW/Release+Management+Guide#ReleaseManagementGuide-Updatingthevcpkgport]
